intro: Calceolaria sinclairii, commonly known as the Sinclair's slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking and unusual floral display. Calceolaria sinclairii is a perennial herb that prefers partial shade and well-drained soil.
